title: 108_s822
content: The "Child Care Lending Pilot Act of 2003" may be cited as the Short Title. It establishes the Child Care Business Loan Program. The Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to authorize loans with restrictions and limitations. The Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to authorize loans for small, non-profit child care businesses, subject to approval by the Administration and meeting eligibility requirements. The Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to allow loans for small, non-profit child care businesses, with eligibility requirements applicable to for-profit businesses. The Small Business Administration must submit reports on the program implementation every 6 months to specific committees. The Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to allow loans for small, non-profit child care businesses. Reports on program implementation must be submitted every 6 months to specific committees, including details on dates of implementation, rules issuance, and loan statistics. The Comptroller General of the United States is required to submit a report on child care small business loans by March 31, 2006. The Business Investment Act of 1958, as amended, requires reports to be submitted to specific committees on the implementation of the loan program, including evaluation of timeliness, effectiveness, and participation of Certified Development Companies, lenders, and small businesses. The Business Investment Act of 1958 mandates reports on the loan program's implementation, including marketing strategies and details on child care small businesses that applied, were approved, and received loan disbursements. The Administrator of the Small Business Administration will issue final rules within 120 days to implement the loan program authorized by the Small Business Investment Act of 1958. The amendments made by this section will be in effect until September 30, 2006, applying to all loans made during that period. The reports will include the number of businesses in each state, total loan amounts, and average loan amounts and terms. The loan program authorized by the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 will be in effect until September 30, 2006, covering loans made during this period.
